title: Program Catalog Management Accounting

school.name: School of Accountancy, Management, Computing, and Information Studies (SAMCIS)

program_name: Bachelor of Science in Management Accounting
slu_vision_mission: Saint Louis University is envisioned as an excellent missionary and transformative educational institution zealous in developing human resources imbued with Christian Spirit and who are creative, competent and socially involved.
school_vision_mission: The School of Accountancy, Management, Computing, and Information Studies (SAMCIS) is envisioned as the center of excellence in Business, Management, and Information Technology Education, committed to the creative, competent, and Christian formation of individuals, who can be agents of progress in the changing local and international business and information technology environments.
educational_objectives: Demonstrate professional values, ethics, and attitudes of a management accountant.
Demonstrate in-depth knowledge and skills in management accounting and related disciplines.
Make positive contributions to the profession and support various stakeholders.
Apply creative skills and critical thinking to assist management functions.
learning_outcomes: Apply competencies in social sciences, mathematics, business laws & taxation, and management philosophies in the field of management accounting.
Communicate business concepts and strategies effectively in English and Filipino using appropriate technology.
Resolve business issues and problems with global and local perspectives using knowledge and technical proficiency.
Employ technology as a tool to capture financial and non-financial information, generate reports, and support decision-making.
Present financial and other reports, analyses, and decisions to management and stakeholders.
Recommend solutions to social and business issues using accounting, financial reporting, taxation, and IT knowledge.
Apply accounting and tax policies in accordance with financial reporting standards and regulations.
Conduct ethical research in management accounting to identify theory-practice gaps and generate knowledge.
Conduct business feasibility studies covering market, finance, HR, and accounting viability.
Apply knowledge and skills to respond successfully to various assessments.
Practice professionalism, corporate citizenship, ethics, and inclusivity in the profession.
Continually develop competencies as a Filipino Louisian management accountant in light of global developments.
Work effectively and independently in multidisciplinary and multicultural teams.
Practice Christian values in personal and professional endeavors as Louisians in the service of the CICM mission.

admission_policies.freshmen: Must pass SLU College Entrance Examination (SLU-CEE), conducted mid-October to mid-December. First semester admission starts mid-April.
admission_policies.transferees: Accepted in all programs except Bachelor in Medical Laboratory Science. Must take Qualifying Exam (QE), Personality Test, and Interview. Foreign transferees must pass English Proficiency Test (EPT).
admission_policies.graduate_students: Must have prerequisite degree. Master’s: Baccalaureate degree. Doctorate: Master’s degree in related field.
foreign_students: Apply at least 6 months before start of term.
Must be in Baguio at least 4 weeks before classes begin.
Must pass EPT, SLU-CEE/QE/GPEE, and Personality Test.
Undergo Preadmission Processing at the Student Affairs Office.
Must secure a valid Student Visa.
